alert.note: Alert for Lawrence (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 02 at 6:41PM CST until March 03 at 9:25PM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Big Nance Creek at Courtland affecting Lawrence County. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Nance Creek at Courtland. * WHEN...From this evening to late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Lowland flooding begins on the left bank of the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 PM CST Thursday the stage was 12.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 14.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.5 feet on 02/24/2022. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
